alert.note: Alert for Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 8:19PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Greenwood County through 900 PM CDT... At 818 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Hamilton, or 12 miles north of Eureka, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Madison, Hamilton and Thrall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
